title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Faces Questions From Senators
sub_head: Day two of confirmation hearings for the Supreme Court nominee is expected to touch on her record as a judge and public defender
body:
WASHINGTON—Senators are getting their first chance to question Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson, the first Black woman picked for the court—and she will have a chance to respond to Republican contentions that she is soft on crime.
Judge Jackson, 51 years old, sat through more than four hours of opening statements from members of the Senate Judiciary Committee on Monday, with Republicans telegraphing that they plan to home in on her years as a defense lawyer and later as a judge who they say was lenient on criminals.
